isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - GENERAL PROCEDURES - APPLICATION OF ADHESIVE IN BEARING BORES

svcproc.title: APPLICATION OF ADHESIVE IN BEARING BORES
svcproc.para: Use Loctite Sleeve N' Bearing Mount No. 609 (Green).

step1.para: Clean the oil and dirt from outer diameters of bearing cups and bearing bores in the carrier and bearing caps. There is no special cleaning required.

Apply axle lubricant to the bearing cones and the inner diameters of the bearing cups of the main differential. DO NOT get oil on the outer diameter of the bearing cup and DO NOT permit oil to drip on the bearing bores.

Apply a single continuous bead of the adhesive to the bearing bores in the carrier and bearing caps. Apply the adhesive 360° around the smooth, ground surfaces ONLY. DO NOT put adhesive on threaded areas ( Figure 48).

figure.caption: Figure 48. Apply Adhesive to Bearing Bores in Carrier

note.para: The Loctite No. 609 adhesives will become hard (dry) in approximately two hours. The following two steps of the procedure must be done in two hours from the time the adhesive was applied. If two hours have passed since application, clean the parts again and apply new adhesive.

step1.para: Install the main differential assembly, bearing cups and bearing caps into the carrier. Refer to ASSEMBLE THE MAIN DIFFERENTIAL AND RING GEAR ASSEMBLY.

Adjust preload of the differential bearings, backlash and tooth contact patterns of the gear set as required using the normal procedures. Refer to ADJUST PRELOAD OF DIFFERENTIAL BEARINGS, and ADJUST BACKLASH OF THE RING GEAR , and CHECK TOOTH CONTACT PATTERNS OF THE GEAR SET.
